conclusion: Understand the geometry and apply optics principles, specifically reflection and refraction laws.
Laser beam enters optical fiber at point O with incident angle of 45 degrees, undergoes total internal reflection at point A.
Angle of incidence at point A is theta, angle of reflection is also theta due to law of reflection.
At point A, angle between incident beam and normal to surface is theta, angle between reflected beam and normal is also theta.
Angle between incident beam and horizontal line (parallel to normal at O) is 45 degrees.
Angle between incident beam and vertical line (normal at A) is 90 degrees minus theta.
Beam undergoes total internal reflection, angle of incidence at A must be equal to critical angle for total internal reflection.
Geometry gives relationship between alpha and theta.
From geometry, alpha equals 90 degrees minus theta.
Substitute alpha equals 45 degrees into equation.
Solve for theta: theta equals 90 degrees minus 45 degrees equals 45 degrees.
